website_summaries.verdict: This affordable router makes streaming 4K content, online gaming, and general WiFi usage a pleasant experience for everyone using your network.
pros: Effective dual-band technology ensures a stable connection
Easily covers up to 2,500 square feet
Able to manage many devices at once
cons: Larger homes and offices will need a router with wider coverage

customer_reviews.title: No-Frills Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: Prior to this purchase, I had 3 other wireless routers that I returned because they just won’t work! I got tired so I bought the cheapest one (this) instead. To my surprise, this is the one that worked for me. I like the router admin page’s ease of use, as well as the phone app (named “Tether”) made by TP-Link. The admin page can also generate a QR code which you can print and put in a wall so whenever you have guests, they can just scan the QR code to connect to the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Kikkomann

customer_reviews.title: Best out-of-the-box experience!
customer_reviews.text: The router arrived while I was at work, so my teenage son transferred all the cables from the old router to the new one, configured the password, and everything worked perfectly without any advanced config. Our network printer connected flawlessly to the router, and I then reconfigured the printer on 3 computers running Windows 10. It has never been so easy to set up that printer. Much easier than my old Netgear router ever was.
customer_reviews.author: NerdyElf

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a 15 year old router I had but it works beautifully. If I would have known that it would work this good I would have bought it a long time ago. Covers the entire apartment all the way to the street and parking lot. Says to can handle 50 devices so I am not sure about that but I do know at least 12 devices it can support. No drop signal or dead spots. Fast deliver to.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I installed several smart devices with different aps in my condo and became concerned I may open my network to hacking. Replaced my old router with a built in modem with this TP-Link AC1750 and a TP-link Modem. After reading some of the reviews I had real concerns about failing on the installation. The installation of both were easy and I was able to get all of my devices back on wifi quickly. I installed all of the smart home devices on the guest band keeping them out of my network. Everything is working better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy legs

customer_reviews.title: Affordable yet reliable
customer_reviews.text: This being my second tp-link router, I love the reliability of the product and they have excellent tech support when needed. This model comes with the tether app that is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan W

customer_reviews.title: Best Interface & Features
customer_reviews.text: Gigabit confirmed. After a much troubleshooting, I’m getting full 950mb+ speed thru Ethernet on the Router. Sadly Gigabit is too advanced & nothing supports gigabit wifi yet so there’s no way to test wifi speeds. It’s future proof I guess. My iPhone maxes out at 250mb & I hit that easy. The UI & LED night time settings are worth a try. ZERO latency on PS4. Instant HD streaming. 4 stars cuz there’s no way to test the wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Cuevas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.  Good coverage
customer_reviews.text: It was super easy to install. The internet reception went from poor to good in the living room. That is important because I want to cut the cord on my tv and do live streaming.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieA

customer_reviews.title: Updated: Improved Stability
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED REVIEW: The admin user interface has gotten better and the overall performance/reliability of the 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz radios has improved. Not perfect, but much better.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzfuster

customer_reviews.title: We were very disappointed with this router
customer_reviews.text: We were very disappointed with this router. We wanted to replace our good old Netgear router which was limiting our internet to about ~50/13 Mbps. When we connected the Tp-Link router the speed was about ~2/0.5 Mbps. We reinstalled the old Netgear and went back to the higher speeds. We thought the new router was defective so Amazon replaced it very promptly. Unfortunately the replacement performed exactly as the previous so we had to return it. Perhaps there was a comparability issue with the modem or other gear but we could not identify the problem even with the expert assistance of the T-Link hone techs. Now we are back to research mode for another router.
customer_reviews.author: Peter R Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install but just ONE problem.
customer_reviews.text: It is almost entirely useless. Input is 70 Mbps, Wireless throughput at 2 foot range is 8 Mbps or less.That is about 11% of rated throughput. Makes a stylish paperweight, though. TP-link FIRST THING said, "it needed new firmware". They knew it did not work when it shipped. How they got JD Power award, is a mystery. Any product needing new firmware, (out of the box) will only go downhill from there. It is going back ASAP. Never another TP-link product for me. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Junk_Product_NO-MORE

customer_reviews.title: Great router with great speed and coverage!
customer_reviews.text: Great coverage and super fast. I have a 1700 sqft home and this router has signal everywhere. The router is placed downstairs in a corner and the speed is phenomenal with very low loss, even upstairs in the farthest opposite corner! The app is awesome as well and allows you to configure everything, including passwords, name, block list, parental control, ect.
customer_reviews.author: Karmjeet B.

customer_reviews.title: Drops the Connection Every 48 Hours or So
customer_reviews.text: This is the second TP link router I have purchased in a month, and both had the same problem: It worked fine, had a strong signal, showing up to 900Mbps downloads and uploads with my new fiber optic service, and would simply shut off every few days. I waited to see if it would happen twice, and it did. This is after the firmware upgrade. Amazon is pushing this brand, giving them lots of slots, prime deals, etc., but I'll never buy another. I took this pic without a flash or light so the LEDs would show. When it looked like this the only solution is to unplug and plug it back in again.
customer_reviews.author: Zesty Mordant

customer_reviews.title: Do not expect great signal improvement right off
customer_reviews.text: Installation with my existing gateway not easy. Actually cancelled order but att tech came out to help and got the broadband working and connected the router on router setup for me. I was able to do the rest too many variables in making the claims of superb range and connectivity. It is unique to each installation. My improvement is marginal. But it is easier to move the new bridged router to a better location than an the gateway so I've decided to cancel the return and hope i can set it up in a better location.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not update firmware . Mine died within 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Their website landing page for support says in red bold font. Upon firmware update , it would not reset to factory default or connect. Tech support was standard unplug, replug, reboot, etc... . After 20 minutes, they asked me to return it. Worst part is that no Wi-Fi for 2 days until next one delivered. It was easy to install and Tether app was good. My advise be careful and wait for them to fix the issue.
customer_reviews.author: K. DESAI

customer_reviews.title: Added coverage and speed throughout backyard of 2500 sq ft. house
customer_reviews.text: House specs: 2500 sq ft. With router/modem connection in front upstairs bedroom. Coverage now reaches the far end of the backyard. Originally didn’t love the distance this added to my WiFi coverage, but after changing the SSID names to my current network, it has boosted the WiFi signal about 30-40 feet in the backyard where the signal was very weak, if any. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Z E

customer_reviews.title: Firmware issue
customer_reviews.text: Wasted an entire evening troubleshooting the fact that the router appeared to configure without a problem and set up Network’s, but my devices that were connected could not access the internet. This is the Archer A7 and does not appear to be compatible with their app. Looks like a firmware issue. Returning this router. I’m extremely unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Minea

customer_reviews.title: Router died after a week.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing only a week ago. For sone reason the internet died and on the router all the lights are off except for the internet which shows a dim red. No other lights cone on. Modem has internet and reseting the router does nothing. Returning and hopefully will get a working router.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Still a nice choice
customer_reviews.text: I have used this router for over a year, very happy. When a friend told me about her wifi issue (log cabin big thick walls) I said(retired tech..), I would take a look She had a very old device, signal 15 feet away was almost nonexistent. I hooked this up (easy install) and in a matter of seconds a nice steady signal all over the cabin.
customer_reviews.author: FairweatherNine

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE do not waste $65/your time
customer_reviews.text: Did my research, read the reviews, and figured I'd try this router out anyways due to the great overall ratings, affordability, and high esteem that I hold TP-Link under for many years preceeding. This router worked great for 1 month then randomly decided to stop working and after 2 hours on the phone with my local ISP, I happened to have their stock router in-hand and their router worked promptly...very disappointing and honestly, rather upset that I have to bash TP-Link's reputation into the ground like this, but the return window (7 days after it expired of course) closed on me and I'm out $65 and a router.
customer_reviews.author: KeecatGirl

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as a VPN Client.  Can't upgrade firmware to DD-WRT.
customer_reviews.text: I had read this had VPN support, but it seems only on the server side and not as a client. In other words you can't use it to connect to a VPN server such as NORD-VPN using the openVPN protocols. I had also read that you could upgrade the firmware to DD-WRT, but this is version 5.0 and is not supported.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A Warren

customer_reviews.title: Stutters and chokes
customer_reviews.text: Like some others reviews say, I had frequent WiFi connection problems with this router. At random times one or another device would appear to have a strong signal but wouldn’t get any throughput or would get very slow. I know it was the router and not my ISP, since I could fix the problem by disconnecting and reconnecting the device to WiFi, but the problem would recur soon enough. I checked to make sure I had the latest firmware to see if that could be the issue, but it said I did already. In other respects this product was good, setup and mgmt were easy to do via the web interface and iPhone app.
customer_reviews.author: Sashy

customer_reviews.title: FAST, strong wifi, Simple setup. What more could you want!?!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This wireless router is impressive! I have switched from a 4g Verizon Mifi pack, so I'm probably easily impressed, but just had Charter Spectrum 100mbs installed. Hooked up and speed checked this wireless router on 5ghz and showed a download rate of 228mbs while I was streaming HD video on another device at the same time! Stupid easy to set up via android phone app. Less than 15 minutes from box to blazing fast wifi! Can't speak to longevity, but if you're reading this a few months from now and there are no updates, then it is holding up great!
customer_reviews.author: Brian E.

customer_reviews.title: It just doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It worked perfectly for the first week and then I started to notice that my internet speeds were barely 5 MB/s. This is not due to the cable company or modem because my internet speed was fine when connected directly and not using this router. Within a month the router stopped receiving internet from the modem all together for hours at a time. I purchased this just over 2 months ago and the internet port no longer works at all.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Cappleman

customer_reviews.title: Only works when it works
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it's fine as a WAP, but I've never had a WAP that lost connection to the router as frequently as this one does. It goes offline constantly making it virtually useless. It is connected directly into my WAN router (Xfiniity box) but loses internet several times a day and does not recover without unplugging and replugging either power or ethernet cable. No other devices that are connected to the ethernet or directly to the router lose connection (or at least they recover seamlessly, so this isn't a DNS issue on the router). I'm replacing this piece of plastic with something NOT TP-link brand.
customer_reviews.author: C. Heartwell

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to install
customer_reviews.text: I could not install this router after I received it. I was in the middle of renovations and had complications. The return window has closed and I cannot return it now. This is supposed to be a highly rated router, but never could get it to connect to the internet. I am more skilled with tech issues than the average person and I finally gave up after trying every suggestion and even watching a you tube video. Maybe it has something to do with the phone company I use for internet service, I just don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gave up the Ghost
customer_reviews.text: Have had this product 11 months. Thought I did enough research to buy a reliable longterm router. Much to my surprise in month 11, the wifi started arbitrarily dropping data packets, lowering the transfer rate on both bands. I had terribly severe connectivity problems. No amount of troubleshooting fixed the problem and the wifi eventually became completley useless with no data transfer to any device. I thought connecting via hardwire ethernet would solve my connectivity problems. However, the direct ethernet also severely dropped data packets. Eventually had to replace router with one from a well known company to fix the internet connectivity. I had connectivity issues for a couple of months before the router finally gave up the Ghost.
customer_reviews.author: Kingshopper

customer_reviews.title: For Verizon Fios
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router to save $180 per year on Verizon Fios Router Lease. The router works as intended. If you have Verizon Fios, first you have to release the dynamic ip from your Verizon router, disconnect it right away from DC outlet and then just plug your new router, and you are back to business.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an outdated router that I had given my mom years ago. It has a good strong signal. The house is a 2,400 ranch with the router on one end and the signal is strong at the other end of the house. It has nice features and an easy to navigate interfaces. The issue came when I connected her Roku smart tv to the 5ghz band. It lost it's connection at least once a day and the router required a reboot to re-establish a connection. I switched it to the 2.4ghz band and it has not disconnected once since.
customer_reviews.author: J. Baylor

customer_reviews.title: Ordered for dual band, bandwidth, and vpn support
customer_reviews.text: I've had good luck with TP-Link routers and needed upgrade to handle hi-res cameras as well as install vpn link(s). In process of setting up and experimenting w/vpn and security systems. One thing I don't like is that I apparently have to connect to tp-link to manage the router instead of having direct access as I did in older router. Not good if you want to run a private network for security cameras & other controllers without any need to access internet. Opens up router to unwanted outside access. To me it seems like "control" like Microsoft & Apple as well as other mnfgrs
customer_reviews.author: clfplvw

customer_reviews.title: changed our streaming  life at home and saved us a ton of money
customer_reviews.text: This singe router replaced 2 Apple Airport Extremes and 2 Expresses, all extended via ethernet. improved our connectivity in the house (1200 sq ft), attached garage and back yard too. Simple to setup and administer. I used the web interface. I will install theapp it some point as a system monitor but so far everything is solid. we stream both music and videos and have 5 connected devices and 1 connected TV. Was considering one of the newer netgear or google systems that run 200-400 bucks and so glad i tried this first
customer_reviews.author: Clint Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Doubled my internet speed.
customer_reviews.text: Doubled my speed on interent wifi speed test over my old router. Setup was kind of clumsy , I stumbled through it and got it done but I was never sure during the whole process if I was doing the right thing. But so far so good now that it is up and running . My old Linksy was slow as wagon wheels but it was reliable and stable, I hope this new one is as reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Alabama

customer_reviews.title: This is not for NORD VPN.
customer_reviews.text: If you are specifically trying to use this router for NordVpn services (to be anonymous on the internet), this router is not for you. NordVpn uses a different feature in the routers called "VPN Client." This router only has a "VPN Server" feature. They are not the same. ExpressVPN or iPVanish might work with this router, but I prefer to use NordVPN. You might try calling NordVpn technical support if you are trying to use this router to set up VPN services.
customer_reviews.author: XxAmazon$hoppeRxX

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular OpenWRT support
customer_reviews.text: You can just install OpenWRT on this sucker right out of the box using the factory firmware from OpenWRT. It's 100% compatible, and has great support for everything and waaay more powerful than the default firmware. So many other routers you end up fighting with. This one just accepts it and you're ready to rock!
customer_reviews.author: C. N. Lohr

customer_reviews.title: So far I am impressed
customer_reviews.text: This was fairly easy to install (my home network is a little more complex than most so I ended up skipping all the "easy" installation options and did just about everything manually). So far this is working very well in my smallish house with good coverage on both bands. The throughput seems zippy and I appreciate the gig ethernet on all of the ports. I have attached a 1 TB USB drive to the port and that seems to work as expected providing both SMB connectivity and ftp. I am considering installing dd-wrt firmware for the extra functionality, but at the moment it's doing just about all I really need and is being well-behaved.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hanson

customer_reviews.title: UNRELIABLE ROUTER w/ POOR PERFORMANCE. Wish I could return
customer_reviews.text: 1. WiFi signal is weaker than my EoL Asus RT-N66U. 2. Wired AND WiFi service and connectivity is UNRELIABLE - having to reboot the router frequently to keep devices connected and performant. 3. Updates are infrequent 4. Finally updated the firmware via the online update and cannot log into the router: Going to  and get "No Such File or Directory" - can't log in. It's all but bricked. This is what I get for buying a CHEAP router. Thank you, TP LINK.
customer_reviews.author: Justin C.

customer_reviews.title: 50 devices? More like 15, IF you're lucky!
customer_reviews.text: It claims it can handle up to 50 devices. I have a Smart home. If I connect more than 15 devices (far less than half of what it claims it can handle!) It kicks EVERYTHING off and won't let ANYTHING reconnect until I reset the router. Do you have any idea what a pain it is to have reset the router and reconnect 18 devices LITERALLY every other freaking day? This thing is garbage, and was sold to me under false pretenses!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Famous

customer_reviews.title: Last 4 months
customer_reviews.text: This was great while it lasted, but after 4 months it is now causing us to have to unplug and restart multiple times a day. Strangely, one device will be connected to the internet via wifi fine, but then another device will connect to the wifi and have no internet connection. So I know it is not our service that is being spotty, and it is not the wifi connection itself, but the router which is randomly failing to connect devices through to the internet. Even another router that is daisy chained via patch cable to this one. This has been happening over and over for several days. Wife restarted this router 5 times today. Have to replace. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: bradw2k

customer_reviews.title: Not *fully* supported by OpenWrt yet(?)
customer_reviews.text: If you are like me you are thinking this is supported by OpenWRT bc the model number (AC1750) is reused from Archer C7 to Archer A7 (this product). Archer C7 is fully supported by OpenWRT. Archer A7 is not yet. However, with some elbow grease, and creating a linux VM to build the firmware on, I did get OpenWRT installed on this Archer A7 and put some very detailed instructions on how to do it on a GitHub pull request (1462). I think you would need to search for that so that this review isn't deleted. Very happy with the product now that I have OpenWRT installed.
customer_reviews.author: Guvnarrr

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough.
customer_reviews.text: I have a desktop ONE room away; and every week without fail this router requires a complete reset. This began roughly 4 weeks back; after of course I could return it, go figure. If you need a very basic router one where you don't mind losing internet every week and have to reset it go ahead. Edit: KEEPS LOSING INTERNET.......AT LEAST TWICE A WEEK. Garbage product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Nason

customer_reviews.title: Good signal strength
customer_reviews.text: My internet provider modem was causing me to drop my VPN connection when working remote. The technician stated that I needed a wifi extender...not so I just needed a better wifi router signal because this one is in the the exact location of the providers router. This also makes it so I won't need to reset all my wifi passwords when the internet provider has to replace my modem or I change providers.
customer_reviews.author: southernlady

customer_reviews.title: A Disaster
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to set up. Had to reboot computers, router, and modem one after the other for at least three cycles before it would even work. Plan on over four hours for this process. After a few weeks, the internet connection gradually became erratic. Would constantly get notices "site can't be reached ... connection took too long." Repeating the search seven or eight times would sometimes get through. Tech support not available when I needed it. Wasted many weeks with this product and will buy a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: MusicHound

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality these cost $10-$12 to make + $5 shipping (if that). Don’t buy from China. I
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t called Tech support I bought this to flash OpenWRT had it working but likely misconfigured it. Why the low review? Because it’s dirt chip components, plastic and manufacturing. It’s made in Vietnam which I like compared to China. Don’t buy networking products from Amazon from China. I have been looking at various devices and in particular the smart lights that have ESP32’s in them such as the Tula stuff? They all strangely have connections to Skype. I use two firewalls to stop inbound threats and outbound traffic. Outbound stuff is VPN’d usually from device to router router then used a second VPN out. You would be shocked to see what some of these devices seem to connect to.
customer_reviews.author: Mid-West

customer_reviews.title: Great router and very affordable
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these routers and they both work really well. One is in the basement, and one upstairs. We're able to get very fast and reliable internet connections which really helps with working from home. Set up was very easy and only took a few minutes. The app works really nicely. Our tech friend helped us find this one, and we love it. Very affordable. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amy-n-Dave

customer_reviews.title: So Far, Handling 4 Concurrent Users Successfully
customer_reviews.text: Was using a cheaper TP-Link wi-fi router. With the recent shelter-in-place orders, two adults on video conference calls and two kids streaming, the conference calls were experiencing intermittent glitches and reconnect issues. Swapping in this Archer A7 seems to have resolved the conference call issues. The main difference with this router is that you cannot name the two different bands (5G & 2.4) differently so if you have smart devices and other users connecting to the different bands, even if you name the new router the same as the old, some devices may have to be reconfigured. Not a huge deal, but one worth noting.
customer_reviews.author: peejmeister

customer_reviews.title: We're zipping along now.
customer_reviews.text: Our Verizon router was moving very slow. Even thought we had upgraded to the 100/100 package, Verizon did not send us new equipment and our speed was ridiculous. I was averaging 3 download and 22 upload. After reviewing products, we decided to take a chance on this and I am so glad we did. It was so easy to set up - just plug the included Ethernet cord into the old router and set up your login through their app. I'm a little bit of a techie, but this would have been simple for anyone. We went from 3 to 110 in a matter of seconds. Everyone in the house is happy - no more drops or lags! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Mccauley

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Set this up in my 2 Brm apartment to replace an inexpensive ($34.99) router to try and get better signal in other rooms of the apartment. Set it up according to directions and had worse coverage than my cheap Netgear unit. Went to tech support and had them walk me through set up to ensure I was doing it correctly...I was...still poor signal strength. It's now in a box and I'm using the old Netgear unit again. Frustrating because I did a fair amount of research on the AC1750 and it was given 5 star, glowing recommendations from several sources.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Linksys WRT1200 that was slacking as I added more devices to the 5GHz band. I got this so I could disable the 5GHz band on my Linksys (to have it exclusively run my legacy devices on 2.4GHz) and use this as my dedicated 5GHz router. The setup worked way better than I expected. Easily getting the full bandwidth from my ISP (200Mbps) and even faster between devices. I have about 15 devices to this router on 5GHz (I didn't test the 2.4GHz prior to disabling that radio), and it works exceptionally throughout my home (and to my backyard). A very happy purchase!
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: Tp-Link AC1750 is a WINNER!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a TP-LINK AC1750 after extensive online research (beyond just AMA) and the positive reviews were spot on. In my case, this wifi router was the only change made to cover a 3k sqft, 2-story home. Farthest rooms went from 3-5 Mbps to 30+ Mbps. Near rooms went from 10 Mbps to triple digits. Being able to establish two separate guest networks (one 2.4GHz and one 5GHz) made managing signal to four FireSticks easy and reliable. Setup user interface was simple, powerful, and logical. Did not grade tech support, since I did not need them! Definite recommend from me.
customer_reviews.author: XEagleDriver

customer_reviews.title: Very weak Wi-Fi signal
customer_reviews.text: Update - ABSOLUTE TRASH Can see the WiFi router inside the house, signal range about 25’! Wanted to like this modem but the signal is so weak I can literally walk out side where I can see the unit and a 50' the signal drop out, Tech support saw my review about the need of a SMA connector for an external antenna and the poor signal. I have mused that next time I would go with mesh WI-Fi repeaters. oh we have those! (More Money!). No do it right the first time, would not recommend for a large (2800 sq ft) house. Its a dissapointment!
customer_reviews.author: Critical Analysist

customer_reviews.title: Very strong Wifi with this
customer_reviews.text: So with the router from spectrum I was getting like barely 100 mbps and with this i am getting over 200. I thin k this is a great buy and very solid although I think there may be even more expensive models where it can be more lightning fast but at this price being around $50 or $60 you cant beat it. If you want something better youll probably have to drop at least $300 or more.
customer_reviews.author: william d.

customer_reviews.title: Buy cheap, buy twice.
customer_reviews.text: This may be a top choice recommendation but it was terrible. I bought 2. One for me, one for my dad for Father’s Day. He has a masters in computer electronics / education so I know it’s not US. We spent all day trying to get this thing to work. The instructions were terrible. It wouldn’t let our wireless printers interface through it. Awful. I didn’t even open mine after dealing with his all day. Returning both. I think the reason it has so many recommendations here is based on price. I’d rather spend double and get a Netgear which is a name I have trusted for 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: PinballWizardess

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if it could remain stable
customer_reviews.text: Really displeased. When it works, it’s great and has wide coverage across our entire home... but it’s just very very unstable. Latest firmware at the time of this writing and nothing but problems retaining a stable 2.4 or 5ghz connection. Things work fine for a few hours than require a power cycle to correct packet loss, radios going up and down, disconnects and other unstable connection Issues with a myriad of devices (including IOS, Android, harmony ultimate and ip cameras). UI features are also way too basic. Debating trying a c7 firmware or openwrt to see if stability might improve.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any network!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could replace my modem/router combination and have more control over the network features. It took me a moment to figure out the menu options, but I have been able to setup everything I need for DHCP [which some IPS's equipment has locked out] as well as control over who has Internet via the parental controls. I also plan to get a secondary as an access point to expand my WIFI through my entire home as the electrical does interfere which cannot be helped. My entire network is TP-Link, and I would highly recommend them as they have out performed others under my networking conditions.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Amazon saved the day!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this Archer A7 router today. Installation was a breeze, but product registration was a bear. So simple to put a notice on the installation guide: "how to register this product." Plus this router gets almost exactly the same speeds as my old Netgear N600: 25 Mbps download, 3 Mbps upload. I'm go to pack the A7 up and send it back, because I can't seem to find out why my speeds are so low. Unless somebody from TP-Link reads this and provides a way for me to talk to them. EDIT, LATER: I chatted with an Amazon rep, and got the straight story. Now I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: rpc.

customer_reviews.title: Works great after painful setup.  Wireless management doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Wireless management doesn’t work after updating firmware. I’ve tried everything from resetting the router, rebooting, disabling wireless and rebooting my phone. I deleted the app and reinstalled it. It worked perfectly fine from my phone until I updated the firmware, now it’s done. My phone sees the device but it says the “connection to it is unstable and to move closer.” I’m practically on top of it! I can manage it just fine via Ethernet, but not over wireless. It’s a shame an update broke the wireless management capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory C. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Ok here is the truth about this product. Save your money. The signal strength is not what they say it will be. I have a small home and I bought this product because I work from home and needed the range to do my work. Needless to say the ranges is NOT as described. The wifi my cable company provides is just as good and doesn't give me as many buffering as this one. I would recommend buying a better brand and would not recommend anyone buy this.
customer_reviews.author: fernando

customer_reviews.title: How this is exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed. We have tried a few routers in the past even Netgear Nighthawk R7000 (Paid 230 dollars) but none of them even came close to the range this one is providing with a strong and stable connection. We have a two story house with a basement and this router is installed in the basement and we don't have any dead zones in our house anymore. It covers our 3000 Sq feet house and part of the backyard yard with no problem. Now I hope that is last us a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Affan Khan

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: This router performs as expected with one minor exception. I've had it in service for a few days now, but when I try to assign a particular IP to a device by MAC address, the router does what it wants and does not follow my instructions. If that's the only issue, I'm not 100% happy, but it's still worth the price of admission. TBH, I have reached out to them on their FB support page but haven't heard back yet. UPDATE: After performing a firmware update, the router began to act as expected and properly assigned IP addresses in my LAN as instructed. 100% satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Leventhal

customer_reviews.title: Died at 7 months
customer_reviews.text: I must admit when I got this I was very happy. Then about 6 months in - signal strength started dropping. Then wacky stuff started happening like my printer would not find it when searching. It found all my neighbors but not mine and at the same time my tablet would find it. Pick up the router to look at the connections/wires attached and the signal pops back up. Power cycling sometimes helps for a bit. Anyway, a good router should last longer than 7 months. I would have thought with all the 5 stars, this would have been a keeper. Guess not.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: headache to set up
customer_reviews.text: quick setup didn't work. looked up instructions on how to set it up manually. when it finally got to working, the wired speed was somehow slower than the wifi speed. both were much slower than modem speed. looked up what the problem was, and there's tons of forums where people have the same problem of the wired speeds being inconsistent and slow compared to the wifi and modem speeds.
customer_reviews.author: littlebirdie

customer_reviews.title: CPU usage spikes. Good Wi-Fi. Packet loss during gaming.
customer_reviews.text: CPU usage spikes to 100% regularly. Scouring the internet tells me this is either actually a problem OR simply an error with the way the interface reports the CPU usage. If it's an error, why not release firmware to patch it? I believe they have released said firmware, so I'm led to believe the CPU spikes are legitimate. Which is nuts. Since replacing my super old D-link with this I've had constant packet loss issues while gaming. However it's totally inconsistent, so I can't completely blame the router. WiFi signal is strong. Bandwidth seems fine most of the time. User interface is good.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: Better than an overpriced system!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for over a year and it has worked well. A couple weeks ago i tried upgrading to deco mesh and let me tell you... This has the system beat. Connectivity and app are so much better and I was getting no more than 100 mbps with the deco and this one gives me almost all 400mbps on Wi-Fi. I find that because I have an almost full smart house I have to reboot this every now and then but it has great control and strong signal through most of the house. I bought a couple extenders for the front and backyards but this is great on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Tessy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: It was super easy to set up - but I got it because comcast kept telling me my slow speeds were due to the wifi router, which is about 5 years old. I got this one, but was disappointed to find it gave out exactly the same speed as my old one. So I don't know where the problem lies - I doubt it is with this router - I'm sure it has something to do with comcast, but this was easy, VERY affordable, and if I needed to get a new router, I would get this one. As it is, I'm just staying with my old one.
customer_reviews.author: charliecharlie

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for Buck!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a little beast! I have a roughly 3500-5000 sq ft house. The FiOs provided router is all the way in the basement corner opposite to anything and everyone in the house. With this router, i am able to stream seamlessly on both bands offered. the 2.4 is good enough but it will jump you to the 5GHz band if needed which is nice! Huge upgrade and all members of the house can be on at the same time doing whatever you choose!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clears Up Congestion On Network Among Streaming and Upload/Download Applications Home Network
customer_reviews.text: This router is reasonably priced, simple to set up and provides solutions for segregating different types of traffic and the priority of same between 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. Some home camera traffic, some remote monitoring traffic, some streaming traffic, then everyday run of the mill web surfing, email and browsing. I have 3 IP cameras running on the network along with 4 Smart TV's. Had too much congestion on just a 2.4 GHz combo access point/router. Installed the TPLINK router and problems solved.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Selling defective and snoopy products
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Interface says weak security even when saving correct settings...meaning just for show on server, no real security. Lost connections out of box. Settings are changed by TP themselves within the firmware. Had problems installing..said 32 people had same problem.... They are selling defective subpar products and evidently paying for reviews and awards. After trying to use it for 2 days....lost connection twice, settings changed from within, weak signal, blocks your own computer, JUNK. Do not buy this. It has documented security flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Moth

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement router for CenturyLink Fiber
customer_reviews.text: I bought this WiFi router to replace the Centurylink Router that was leased with my home internet service. I was able to duplicate the settings on the CTL router, and this one came online and provides a great WiFi signal- I have a Ring camera that needs good WiFi, and this seems to fit the bill. Was able to get the $10 modem lease off of my bill. It's important to note- This is just a WiFi router, and does not have a modem built-in. If you have Comcast or CenturyLink DSL, you probably need a separate modem. I wired my house with Ethernet, but needed a WiFi access point for phones, iPads, etc.
customer_reviews.author: ghowell

customer_reviews.title: My tested speed went from 50 Mbs to 100 Mbs
customer_reviews.text: My internet speed went from 50 Mbs to 100 Mbs (tested using speedtest.net) just from switching to this Gigabit router. The other important feature for me is that it is a 2 network router. It has a guest network with it's own password. This is useful for multiple users like roommates, etc. It has a lot of other features like Alexa compatibility, integrated USB port to act as Media Server, upgradable, and has app allowing easy management of network. It has good range and can reconfigured to add One Mesh extender for even more range. Best of all not ridiculously expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Prof Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Worst Router On Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the AC1750 for 24 hours and so far I have hit the reset button three times to get access to the internet. When I did the initial set up and trying for two hours to get internet working I finally called support. They had me push the reset button and finally the internet was accessible. As stated above I've had to depress the reset button three times to make the AC1750 work correctly. If you are looking for a reliable wireless router buy from a better manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: L J Max

customer_reviews.title: would not connect to internet
customer_reviews.text: This router would not connect a new Iphone SE, an Iphone 8, a Roku, a new HP desktop, or a Dell laptop to the internet. They all saw the wifi network, but nothing would make them connect to the internet. I tried for hours, my wife tried, and the cable technician tried. We switched back to our old router, and "bingo" connected with no problem. There is obviously something seriously wrong with this product. One ought to be able to hook it up and be running without any fooling around.
customer_reviews.author: digitaldan

customer_reviews.title: Multiple units showed defects after a short period.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to Wirecutter’s recommendation. The first one I received worked well for a few weeks, then started to have moments of no signal (about 30 seconds at a time, several times a day). I returned the unit, thinking it was defective, and got a replacement. The second unit I received waited 3 months to start showing the same issue. There is still a WiFi network, but no internet during these brief windows. My hardwired devices show me that it is the router, not my ISP. As someone who works from home and takes video calls, this router will likely need to be replaced with a more reliable alternative. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jessessky Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good range,  poor connection
customer_reviews.text: For the 1st 2 months this worked great. It has good range and the speeds were good too. Now, it will randomly drop from its high speed down to about 1 mps for a few minutes. It slows down enough to shut down any streaming for until speeds pick back up. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: ShoelessMo

customer_reviews.title: NO SUPPORT available
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router in MId-2019 and am just now trying to install. Almost no detail instruction came with this unit. I've installed 2 routers before and expected no problems. It was unable to connect to my Arris 6 cable modem, thus no access to internet. I re-install old working router and go to TP Link website...it is total BS,,,,no customer support and way to contact them. This is the WORST product support I have ever experienced. My Advice--DO NOT buy TP Link products!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: jwr1945

customer_reviews.title: Great router so far!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get this router after doing some research online. My router that I have from optimum was acting wonky and dropping since the coronavirus lockdown started. So I got this one and it seems to have sped things up a lot and no dropping so far! I’ll update if I have any future issues.
customer_reviews.author: Keri Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Loses speed and flatlines.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my 2.4 ghz Belkin router to maximize the speeds from my ISP. One day later and I was back to my old router. I would do a speed test and this would go from 112 mbps right down to flatline (a couple hundred kbps). All of our devices would have connecting issues. As I'm working from home with kids doing home school, this is unacceptable. I hooked up the old router and my speed and lag issues vanished immediately. I'm returning this for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Swasey

customer_reviews.title: Great speed, easy setup, and best value for the money
customer_reviews.text: This router fits the bill for a mid-range budget device. I was incredibly disappointed to find that the big box stores don't seem to sell mid-range like this anymore...it's either the $30 Netgear model or the fancy "whole home" setup. This TP-Link unit from Amazon fits the happy medium, and I couldn't be happier with the price. Setup was simple, but there are a ton of advanced options in the interface if you want to really tweak and customize your network or setup. TP-Link also has lovely cloud services which make remote management, dynamic DNS, etc. to be a real treat. This is my first TP-Link product and I would most certainly purchase from their brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex&Michael Mansell

customer_reviews.title: TP Link is a Ripoff
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this piece of garbage or any other TP Link products. I bought this mid June and over the past week it started dropping wifi and network connections. I have reset it multiple times and it is unusable. I am past the 30 day return by a few weeks and TP Link support is atrocious. TP Link wants to charge me over half the cost of this piece of garbage to send it back to them to troubleshoot. No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement router for Frontier FiOS Internet service
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace the WIFI router that Frontier rents you for $10/month and so far it is working great having no problem feeding my devices the full 500mbps the fiber internet service provides. If you are going to replace your FiOS router make sure you first go into the router config and release the WAN IP address from it before hooking up the replacement otherwise it will not pull an IP address. Setup of this device was very painless in my case and the WIFI signal is strong enough to provide acceptable signal to my 2200 sq ft home on both 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz.
customer_reviews.author: DaveC

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It works, which is great, although the performance is limited to about 200 mbps, even when wired. 200 Mbps isn't awful, but I had hopes that for a router that advertises itself as being a "gigabit wireless router" the performance would be better. I found that disabling "hardware acceleration" on 2.4 ghz helped to improve reliability. Wireless coverage is fine, but nothing special. Overall a good router, thus the 4-star rating, but nothing particularly special.
customer_reviews.author: Bear!

customer_reviews.title: Best router for multiple devices and smart home use
customer_reviews.text: Great router! We where using an outdated router and having major internet troubles seeing we have multiple echo dots and echo shows, not to mention we stream our shows and movies and also have security systems and gaming systems that rely on the internet. I also needed a router that could handle my lap top for school and tablets as well. Sense we have gotten this router we have had no connection problems and i can control my router with Alexa or my tether app!
customer_reviews.author: Casey Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Totally easy to use and saving serious monthly rental charges
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a great router! We just moved, and after literally 14 years (!) of renting a router for 10$/month from our last cable company, we decided no matter what (!) we were buying a router to lower our bills. We found this on Wirecutter as their budget pick - around 57$ at the time we bought it - called up Fios/Verizon to just doublecheck it was compatible, and YES yes it is! It was super easy to set up - the cable tech didn’t have to do anything - and setting up was a snap. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: REBECCA G

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a fast, very reliable router
customer_reviews.text: I already had an Archer C7, which is very similar and replaced it with this A7, using the C7 in bridge mode. (I don't know if the A7 can be used in bridge mode, but it would be easy to set up as an access point.) These are really great routers for a great price. They just keep on working reliably at high bit rates. The interface is very comprehensive, but easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for Spectrum junk. My Alexa works perfect now!
customer_reviews.text: I was having problems with connectivity and response with my Alexa devices from the crappy “smart router” that Spectrum provided to me for five dollars per month so I decided to try this one to see if it would help the issues. Man, what a difference! There are absolutely no connection issues with Alexa or any of my smart devices since I have switched to this router. I also have excellent coverage. I highly recommend this router if you want to replace your crummy spectrum one.
customer_reviews.author: Chixdigit

customer_reviews.title: Quickly connects and a fast interface
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up to add to my parents home. It improved the coverage greatly. They now have more complete coverage throughout the house. I was also shocked at how fast the router web interface was. I’ve been using a Netgear R6700 with it’s clumsy and slow interface, so this was a refreshing and pleasant surprise. For the price,this can’t be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Juice

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased so far!
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully! After starting work from home, we decided it was time to upgrade our router. Since installing this one, we had far fewer instances where we needed to reset everything. The interface is very user friendly, and I was even able to figure out a port forward, something I had not been able to do myself with previous equipment! Only had it less than a month so I am hoping it is as durable and consistent in the long run as it has made a great first impression on us so far!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha D

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT purchase refurbished
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item hoping to save money from leasing from the internet company. We also upgraded to Gigablast plan. Once we hooked it up to the "new" modem the internet kept cutting off (annoying). Not knowing what the issue was, I kept calling my internet provider for assistance and they couldn't assist. I took it upon myself to purchase a brand new router to see if this would take care of the issue and IT WORKED! Of course, by the time we figured this out we were past the date to return and was unable to return. :( Now I'm stuck with a router that I paid for that was no good.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vega

customer_reviews.title: Best router for your dollars !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Look at the reviews for this router and I must say that this was the best decision I’ve made this year so far. The range you get with this is fabulous and not to mention the WiFi signal strength, 1000 mbps to I believe 1400mbps, then again it all depends on your internet provider but overall I’m truly satisfied with this purchase and see this lasting for several years to come. Also forgot that the app is very user friendly and easy to navigate through and it’s a free app. Highly recommend this router if you love streaming movies, games ,or just your usual browsing the World Wide Web. Hopefully this review helps
customer_reviews.author: leo robinson

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Router and Wi Fi especially for NAS (network attached storage)
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable over the past few months. There has been no need to reboot / restart the system due to loss of WiFi. The Network Attached Storage ( A 3TB hard drive we connected to the USB port) is always available via Windows on a PC or the File Explorer app on either Android or iOS. So I can store all my images and documents centrally and access them via any PC or hand held device if I'm in range of my WiFi. I have complaints. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: When COVID-19 shut down our schools, my daughter and wife (who is a teacher) got laptops and now work/learn at home. This increased use quickly wore out my old router. This one had good reviews so I bought it. Computers/phones go on one channel, while the Roku player/TV's go on another. I'm not super techie but this works great. We can stream educational videos and watch TV all at the same time with no slow downs. Just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Banditrider

customer_reviews.title: 2 months later and signal strength is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but AC1750 product warrants a negative review. I am two months into using the product, and the signal strength is terrible, both in the 5GHz and 2.4GHz bands. Even a few feet from the WiFi gateway, with a clear line of sight, and the signal strength is -57 dBm for the 5GHz band, and -51 dBm for the 2.4GHz band. I have spent hours on the phone with technical support, and it is worthless. I wish I had not bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: David T

customer_reviews.title: Wish the range was better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after returning the AC1200. The AC1200 had great range, but had MANY other issues. This router doesn't have any of the issues of the AC1200, gives me great speeds, and is very user friendly. The only issue is that the range is less than the AC1200. If you have a 2000 sq foot house and this is located on one side of the house, you won't get great signal on the other and it will occasionally drop. If you can place this in the middle of your home (wish I could), you shouldn't have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Physics Dan

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: So we have a 4 person household. 2 teens who game constantly and the missus and me who stream netflix, ect. Our internet maxes out at 10mps, and we rarely have any problems. In fact the boys thought I was wasting my time getting this because they wanted a bigger internet package. But they're quite happy now and believers in better wireless routers. Also I downloaded the Tether app on my phone and it's great. I set up parental controls for internet hours, and can block users from anywhere should they get grounded from their games. Tether also keeps the boys from defeating my parental controls because the controls are are on the cloud, resetting the router does nothing, haha!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Mandatory 2 channels, but works well
customer_reviews.text: Great value router, but does not manage 2.4G and 5g channels automatically as a single SSID (router name on wifi), you have to have 2 separate channels (and it can use a guest channel as well). I would give it 5 stars if it had that feature. Another issue is that in order to turn on QOS (preference for bandwidth to your smart TV for instance) you have to turn off a NAT function that is on by default and it is buried in the advanced options menu.
customer_reviews.author: Carol and David Melvin

customer_reviews.title: I’m typing this using cell phone data :)
customer_reviews.text: I was warned it didn’t have a strong connection from the beginning by the company that set up the internet. It worked fine then though so I thought they were just trying to sell me their stuff. I’ve had it for not even two months and now I can’t get it to pass any internet on from the modem. I know the modem is working cause if I plug the cable straight into my TV it works fine but I can’t get any WiFi in my phone or laptop. Router acts like it’s working (light wise) but it’s just a big huge bluff because even though the network pops up on my phone it can’t load a single thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kate P.

customer_reviews.title: Total crap
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I am giving it 2 stars and not one is because I should have known better. I bought a similar TP-Link (ASIN B00BUSDVBQ) a few years ago and had the exact same problem. Once I changed the network from 192.168.0.1 to 192.168.1.1 the UI becomes inaccessible. You may ask why I need it changed. I have about 20 devices that are configured for the 1.1 network that I would have to change. Never again will I purchase any TP_Link products.
customer_reviews.author: warp

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: To anyone looking to buy: the company we went with for our new house said they provide a router for a fee every month. What they don’t tell you is that they make you pay but at the end of the year if you choose to cancel you have to give it back. We decided to buy our own so for the same price we wouldn’t have to ever give it back if we decided to switch providers thus saving us money in the long run. Works fantastic! Have had zero problems with our internet!
customer_reviews.author: Katkellogs

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link AC1750 Smart WiFi Router - Set-up OK but runs well!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I used the app to set-up up a router. At first it didn't recognize the router. It took a couple of attempts to get in going. It also hung up on establishing the password. After about thirty minutes, it finally worked. So far so good. No drops in signal and speed actually got better as I am now using the max speed from my internet provider. I had been using an older Netgear N600 that started dropping out occasionally. Not sure about all of the smart features that were advertised with this model. Will find out over time I guess.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Wired Connections constantly dropped speeds
customer_reviews.text: So, I have 200+ mbps from my ISP - Spectrum. Brand new out of box TPLINK AC1750 A7 drops speeds on wired connections. Had to constantly reboot it to get speeds back but after 15-30 minutes it just drops again. Speed drop is significant with only getting 5-7 mbps. Upgraded firmware = same thing. Returned it. In looking at all reviews it seems all ac1750 routers may have this issue, regardless of manufacturer, unless your lucky to get a good one. Had to go back to my trusty N300. At least I get 70 mbps without issues.
customer_reviews.author: Skunk

customer_reviews.title: Hate it.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot log in at all through the web browser interface at all. The app is way too vague and over simplified, and I suspect it only works on one device only which is pretty stupid (if that was even the problem). I don't even see if there is an option to change the password and network name, configure the firewall, configure the ip dresses(there's only static of dynamic option), or hide the network. I should have gotten another ASUS router. :(
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Don’t try to install dd wrt
customer_reviews.text: It’s the neutered version of the c7, made exclusively for Amazon. You lose a USB port by buying this model over the c7. But I got mine on a real bargain on a flash sale. Unfortunately for me, I bricked mine trying to install dd wrt. There’s only one beta version, and no uninstaller as of Memorial Day 2019. Dd wrt was very buggy and when I tried to revert it back to tp link firmware , poof. Shot down in flames. Btw, I bought a wrt32x from Linksys next, and I love that router! Blows this one away in every aspect
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wilkerson

product_meta.title: TP-Link AC1750 Smart WiFi Router - Dual Band Gigabit Wireless Internet Router for Home, Works with Alexa, VPN Server, Parental Control&QoS (Archer A7)
product_meta.description: AC1750 wifi router/wireless router. One of routers for wireless internet, wireless routers for home. Dual band router and gigabit router. Ideal as internet router also gaming router. Long range coverage with high speed. Compatible with all 802.11ac devices and below. 5ghz router/5g router Frequency Range: 2.4GHz and 5GHz; Interface Available: 4 x 10/100/1000Mbps LAN Ports, 1 10/100/1000Mbps WAN Port, 1 USB 2.0 Ports; Protocols Supported: Supports IPv4 and IPv6; System Requirement: Microsoft Windows 98SE NT 2000 XP Vista, or Windows 7 Windows 8/8.1/10, MAC OS NetWare UNIX or Linux; Wireless Standards: IEEE 802.11ac/n/a 5GHz, IEEE 802.11b/g/n 2.4GHz.
feature_bullets: JD Power Award ---Highest in customer satisfaction for wireless routers 2017 and 2019
Router for wireless internet, works with Alexa, compatible with all WiFi devices, 802.11ac and older
Dual band router upgrades to 1750 Mbps high speed internet(450 mbps for 2.4GHz + 1300Mbps for 5GHz), reducing buffering and ideal for 4K streaming Comparable to the router NETGEAR R6700
3 external antennas for long range WiFi
Gigabit Router with 4 Gigabit LAN ports, fast access to Multiple connected wired devices, Ideal as a gaming router
Integrated USB port acts as a media Server, easily share your USB drive content
TP-Link tether app easily set up and remotely manage your home network
Industry leading 2 year and Free 24/7 technical support

specifications.Operating System: Microsoft Windows 98SE, NT, 2000, XP, Vista or Windows 7, Windows 8/8.1/10, MAC OS, NetWare, UNIX or Linux
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars17,496 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
